oai_dc:dc.dc:title: GSSW Doctoral Program 40th Anniversary - Part 3 of 3: Dr. Virginia Richarson speaks at the University of Denver Graduate School of Social Work
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Crawford, Ethan
Garrett, Ryan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: PHD program
Doctoral education
Keynotes
Social science
Richardson, Virginia
Denver (Colo.)
University of Denver
Graduate School of Social Work
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dr. Virginia Richardson provides the summation/reactions closing keynote address for the conference on May 2, 2009: "Answering the Carnegie Initiative Call to Action: Rethinking Social Work Doctoral Education." The all-day conference was hosted by the DU Graduate School of Social Work in recognition of the 40th anniversary of its doctoral program. The event included several visioning exercises and discussions led by former GSSW Doctoral Directors, GSSW's first Notable Scholar Award, and presentations by three national scholars: Dr. George Walker, Dr. Ann Nichols-Casebolt, and Dr. Virginia Richardson.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: University of Denver Graduate School of Social Work

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dr. George Walker provides the morning keynote address and responds to the conference theme: "Answering the Carnegie Initiative Call to Action: Rethinking Social Work Doctoral Education." The all-day conference on May 2, 2009 was hosted by the DU Graduate School of Social Work in recognition of the 40th anniversary of its doctoral program. The event included several visioning exercises and discussions led by former GSSW Doctoral Directors, GSSW's first Notable Scholar Award, and presentations by three national scholars: Dr. George Walker, Dr. Ann Nichols-Casebolt, and Dr. Virginia Richardson.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: University of Denver Graduate School of Social Work

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: University of Denver Professor Jeff Jenson provides the introduction and overview for this one-day conference held at the University of Denver Graduate School of Social Work. Tonya Edmond, Ph.D., Associate Dean for Academic Affairs at the Brown School of Social Work at Washington University delivers the morning plenary titled "Training MSW Students to be Evidence Based Practitioners: The Brown School Model."
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: University of Denver Graduate School of Social Work

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dr. Ann Nichols-Casebolt provides the luncheon keynote address for the conference on May 2, 2009: "Answering the Carnegie Initiative Call to Action: Rethinking Social Work Doctoral Education." The all-day conference was hosted by the DU Graduate School of Social Work in recognition of the 40th anniversary of its doctoral program. The event included several visioning exercises and discussions led by former GSSW Doctoral Directors, GSSW's first Notable Scholar Award, and presentations by three national scholars: Dr. George Walker, Dr. Ann Nichols-Casebolt, and Dr. Virginia Richardson.
